sourceDesc.p: New edition edited from photography of Venetus A manuscript.

div.l: Alpha contains prayers of Chrysēs; plague among the army; enmity of the leaders
And Beta has a dream, an assembly, and enumerates the ships.
And then Gamma is from the point of view of Helen; the pitch of battle is only for husbands.
Delta contains an assembly of the gods, many oaths, the onslaught of Ares.
“E”: The son of Tydeus strikes Aphrodite and Ares.
And then Zeta is the fond discourse of both Andromache and Hektor.
And Eta: Aias fights one-on-one with radiant Hektor.
Theta is an assembly of the gods, the power of the Trojans, the boast of Hektor.
And an embassy to implacable Achilleus, is Iota.
And Kappa: men from both sides went forth to spy.
And Lambda. Men of Hektor strike the best of the Danaans.
Mu. By the hands of the Trojans, the Achaians’ wall is hurled down.
And Nu. Poseidon gives power to the Danaans in secret.
Xi. Hera beguiles the Son of Kronos by sleep and the pleasures of the couch.
“O”. The Son of Kronos is angered at Poseidon and Hera.
Pi. Hektor’s spear kills warlike Patroklos.
Rho. The Danaans and Trojans clash over the corpse.
Sigma. Thetis brings arms from Hephaestus for Achilleus.
And Tau. Radiant Achilleus sets aside anger and springs forth.
“U”. Strife arises among the gods and brings strength to the Achaeans.
Phi. By an even greater downpouring, Achilleus overcomes the Trojans.
Chi. And leading him around the walls three times, Achilleus kills Hektor.
Psi. Achilleus completes giving games for the Danaans.
“Ō”. Achilleus, having taken a ransom, gives Priam the corpse of his son.
